title: Calories in Caesar Salad
meta_description: Discover the calorie in caesar salad per serving, including full nutrition breakdown like fat, protein, carbs, and tips for lighter versions.
assumptions: Typical restaurant serving (≈200 g total) with romaine lettuce, croutons, parmesan cheese, and creamy Caesar dressing; no added protein like chicken.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, dressing amount, and ingredients; homemade or restaurant versions differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One typical Caesar salad serving has about 400 kcal, mostly from the dressing.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant info.

tweaks.label: Use low-fat dressing (reduces fat per 100 g)
Omit croutons (removes carbs and some calories per serving)
Add grilled chicken breast (100 g extra protein)

faqs.q: How many calories in one Caesar salad?
faqs.a: About 400 kcal for a typical 200 g serving with standard dressing.

faqs.q: What's the main source of calories in Caesar salad?
faqs.a: The creamy dressing contributes most calories, around 16 g fat per 100 g.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in Caesar salad?
faqs.a: Yes, about 12 g per 100 g, mainly from croutons; fiber is low at 1.5 g.

faqs.q: How to make a lower calorie Caesar salad?
faqs.a: Opt for light dressing, skip croutons, or use vinaigrette to cut ~100 kcal per serving.

faqs.q: Is Caesar salad high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 350 mg per 100 g from cheese and dressing; total serving ≈700 mg.
